error.regex: secret.*not found|no such secret|secret.*does not exist

verdict.summary: A Docker service or Compose stack references a secret that does not exist in the swarm or has not been created. Secrets must be created before services that use them.

dead_ends.action: Hardcoding the secret value in the Dockerfile or docker-compose.yml
dead_ends.why_fails: Secrets end up in the image layer history or version control, creating a security vulnerability

dead_ends.action: Using environment variables instead of Docker secrets for sensitive data
dead_ends.why_fails: Environment variables are visible in docker inspect, /proc/<pid>/environ, and logs; less secure than secrets

workarounds.action: Create the secret before deploying the service
workarounds.how: echo 'secret_value' | docker secret create secret_name - (for Swarm) or define in docker-compose.yml with file: ./secret.txt (for Compose)

workarounds.action: For Docker Compose, define secrets as file-based in the compose file
workarounds.how: In docker-compose.yml: secrets: { my_secret: { file: ./my_secret.txt } } and reference in services with secrets: [my_secret]
workarounds.condition: when using Docker Compose without Swarm mode

leads_to.condition: when missing secrets cause entrypoint scripts to fail

preceded_by.condition: when service dependencies are resolved but secrets are not created

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Secret not found means a Docker secret object is missing, while env file not found means a .env file path in the compose configuration does not exist on disk
